reviews.text: Excellent service and food!!

Outstanding in every aspect! Good was perfectly balanced, great options, varied, toward the healthier side without a sacrifice for taste. Service was a tiny bit slow to get started but then was attentive and precise. I had the #4 Sweet Bacon BLT: sweetness, acidity perfectly contrasted, with textures (bacon, multigrain bread, soft egg), and overall flavors precise and pleasant. There was a little surprise at the end: a perfect chewy, gooey, moist, chocolaty muffin/brownie to finish the meal off. Ambience also soft on the eyes, balanced, and civilized clientele. Highly recommend!
Great selection of plant based choices - during happy hour with a drink.
Was very good
Loved the gluten free eggs Benedict. Ginger matcha latte was great, not too sweet with a good balance of matcha and ginger. Great little restaurant.

I ate here when it was in the former location and it wasnâ€™t great for the following reasons: 1) it took roughly 20 minutes to put in an order. 2)   it took another 15 minutes for them to bring drinks like iced coffee. 3) it took another five minutes for them to let us know that they were out of several items. 4) we didnâ€™t get the food delivered to the table until about an hour and 10 minutes after we initially sat down. The food (and presentation) was unnecessarily fussy.  There were 5 people (family) in this party.

Last night I went to the new location on the corner of 47/9th Ave and I regret to write that we could have chosen a better restaurant again. No doubt this new location is larger and therefore cost more to rent. However, when we sat down, there was only one other table of two people. We had 3 people (friends). Itâ€™s â€œtapas-styleâ€ dishes like fried tofu nuggets and fried kimchi dumplings. So itâ€™s high margin food and not too healthy or filling. Itâ€™s not a big menu, and we really should have looked closer at the menu when we chose to eat here. Again, the food (and presentation of the food) was unnecessarily fussy. We got 7 mostly fried tapas dishes (share) and  drinks. Gratuity was automatically included. The total was roughly $250.
Lovely place for brunch and breakfast

â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸ 5-Star Review for UT47 Kitchen & Bar

After my doctorâ€™s appointment, I decided to stop by UT47 Kitchen & Bar, where I've been savoring to visit. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with warmth, professionalism, and a smile that instantly set the tone for an amazing experience.

The customer service was absolutely top-notch genuine, attentive, and full of positive energy. The food was fresh, flavorful, and clearly made with love from the kitchen. Every bite tasted like care vegan options that are hmm hmm good. How do they make the vegan pouch egg & hollandaise sauce?

What really stood out to me was how smoothly everything ran with only two women working the floor Jasmine & Toshi. Just the two of them smiling, multitasking, serving, and keeping everything in perfect order. Toshi is a perfect ex.that language is NO BARRIER. Communication comes in many forms. Their grace under pressure was remarkable even with customers with huge dogs in a petite space. Jasmine made sure I was comfortable..

I donâ€™t know if these two ladies were my Angelic food angels that day, but either way, itâ€™s definitely a reflection of management and great leadership. It shows when staff are happy, confident, and take pride in what they do that energy flows to every customer.

I left full, happy, and genuinely impressed. I hope every time I come back, the food and service remain just the same. I have to find a way to add UT47 Kitchen & Bar into my budget ğŸ˜… Thank you, for a truly refreshing dining experience. Iâ€™ll definitely be back!
Angelic

I've visited this place numerous times since the opening at the old location and never been disappointed. The consistency of their food and service quality is impressive. In my opinion, this is the top breakfast spot in Hell's Kitchen/Times Square and possibly all of NYC.

The food is not only delicious but also visually appealing, making for great photos. They look pretty artistic. While the prices may be slightly higher than others, itâ€™s worth paying. The owner's secret sauces add an extra layer of flavor to their sandwiches and eggs. I've shared BLT sandwiches with colleagues, and they all ask for more

I would like to thank the owner for bringing this exceptional dining experience to the neighborhood and for maintaining its high standards.
Comida e ambiente incrÃ­veis! Nota 10!
Amazing vegan food

This place has just taken the top spot on my list. They cover many culinary bases with their selection. All our menu choices were excellent. The workers demonstrate extraordinary pleasantness and openness. This restaurant creates a pleasant environment.
Had the best brunch ever the food were amazing and the interior is aesthetic and  was really cute.
Tolle, kleine Bar mit sehr gutem Essen und Snacksâ€¦. eine echte Empfehlung!
Amazing. Had such an amazing brunch here with my honey.
Great breakfast and coffee
One of the best breakfasts Iâ€™ve ever had. You should also try the homemade tomato soup. If I could I would give more than 6 stars!
A bit pricy but totally worth it. The vegan salmon tastet like real one and the egg benedict was just perfect ğŸ‘ŒğŸ‘ŒğŸ‘Œ

We came in for a drink, my husband ordered a glass of champagne, bartender showed him the bottle and asked if it was ok before he opened it, we did not see him pour it but it was obviously an old opened bottle he served from as there wasnâ€™t a single bubble and it was very flat. I asked for a bourbon old fashion and was served a vermouth tasting thing. We only had the two drinks and our bill was 60 dollars. Felt completely ripped off. Would not recommend going to this place
Great breakfast and brunch place. Eggs Benny are ace! Mocha Latte and Flat White taste very good. Good service, cozy atmoshpere. Not too cheap, but worth the money considering portions and quality.
Great fooy

Lovely! Delicious food and drinks. The coffee was the best Iâ€™ve had in NYC during my stay. I had the vegan bacon tofu Benedict which was absolutely scrumptious. They had an extensive vegan menu. I donâ€™t know how I didnâ€™t find this place until my second to last day here! Donâ€™t miss it.
Had a great experience at UT47; the staff was incredibly attentive, the food was delicious, and the design of the space is modern and unique. Definitely a spot worth checking out!

I could describe it in just one word... Spectacular! The food is incredible! Delicious! We ordered the bagel and wow, what an amazing dish!
Would I recommend it? A thousand times over

We found vegan gluten-free eggs Benedict's at midnight! Absolutely delicious! I had the tofu bacon and my husband had the salmonâ€¦ The vegan salmon was a teeny bit weird but overall really well done and super flaky like a real piece of salmon. I would highly recommend!
This place was amazing. Food was excellent. Vegan options so good!! Service was friendly and attentive. Very comfortable atmosphere. Loved it!
To be able to order two different vegan eggs Benedicts at midnight on a Friday is reason 100,000 I love NYC.  Great flavors. Great service. Warm welcome.
This place is giving a great breakfast!!!
Wow. Everything wow. We where a group  of 10 all had different plates all amaizing. I ate the zesty waffle and trust me coming back again

Adore UT (the place and the owner). My 13yo and I ate there before an afternoon Broadway show and had a wonderful experience. The food is beautiful, delicious and presented artfully. The drinks (Chai and Matcha) are also delicious. My daughter said it's the best chai she ever had .UT (owner) was working and brings a special energy to the place. She stopped and chatted with us a couple of times and gave my daughter an extra brownie when she saw how much she enjoyed the first one : ) We will definitely go again next time we visit NY. Love from Colorado. xo

Great experience! Food, drinks and service are amazing.

I turned to UT47 after watching our show because we needed a late-night dinner spot that offered strong vegan options. Lucky for me, they absolutely delivered in that regard.

This late night bar features a plethora of Korean options that would satisfy anyone. Aside from fancy drinks, there was a strong selection of dosirak meals for dinner that we all decided to go in on.

Mine included soy meat bulgolgi over rice with a vegan egg, served with a side of veggie gyoza, beansprouts, and pickled cucumbers. My meal came inside a large bentou box and I gotta say, it was a lot of food even for someone that was ready to ravage some morsels near midnight. The rice had such a great blend of flavors and the bulbolgi tasted just like how I remembered it once upon a time ago.

Being at night, service ended up being a bit slower but I don't blame them since it was mostly one or two individuals serving the entire bar. Be prepared for a small wait if you order food at night.

I'd definitely return again if I wanted to enjoy some late night Korean in a very relaxed environment.

Great menu, great food and a really neat space.

Now for the bad bits. I know I have more than a few pet peaves, and I know I need to work on them. However, I can NOT be the only person that think basic competance is a prerequisite for good service. If you work in an English speaking country, you should speak English. Our server did not. If you are serving food, you should have at least some knowledge of the food you are serving. Our server did not

Also, an Americano is NOT a cup of coffee. It's watered down espresso. Period.

Lastly, if it is a humid summer day with tempuratures above 80F, maybe close the windows and turn on the AC.

The negative feedback seems exaggerated compared to my actual experience. Under all conditions, the cuisine here stays excellent. Delicious preparations with helpful staff in welcoming surroundings. Staff combined approachability with impressive knowledge. This spot has a prime address and we plan to revisit.

Sehr viel Auswahl - auch an vegan und glutenfrei. Und das Essen war wirklich sehr sehr lecker. Ich hatte den Bagel mit dem veganem Bacon und veganem Ei: soo lecker und mal was anderes.
Service war sehr freundlich und sympathisch und auch die Einrichtung hat uns sehr wohlfÃ¼hlen lassen. Etwas teuer, aber gerne wieder!

The vegan eggs benedict is wild, idk how they made it runny like that. None of the flavors were too divisive, but the textures and presentation are immaculate. It gets pretty loud and crowded during peak hours, but not more than any other trendy brunch spot. I'll definitely be back.

Iâ€™ve been a frequent customer of UT47 for the past 2 years and Iâ€™m not sure if thereâ€™s new management or something, but today was my last time going there.

I ordered the veggie dumplings. I have been vegan for 10 years. They accidentally gave me beef. They apologized and redid the order for me. I asked for it to just be made to go. Whatever, mistakes happen.

But I get home to realize YOU GAVE ME BEEF AGAIN!! Iâ€™m not sure if you guys thought this was funny to do this twice, but Iâ€™m never going here again. Honestly so upsetting and a little insulting to not be taken seriously.

If thereâ€™s a new management, get it together. Vegan friends, donâ€™t go here. They obviously have some kind of issue in the kitchen, or just like messing with us. So so so sad and unfortunate. Was one of my favorite places in the neighborhood.
Very friendly and courteous staff. It wasn't super loud or anything and the food was pretty good. They have decent happy hour offerings (which includes non-alcoholic beverages if requested).

Beautiful place with an amazing interior design, very cozy atmosphere. The staff is always friendly and polite. I usually come here for breakfast, which is always delicious. The only thing I wish was different is the policy that you canâ€™t stay with just a coffee. Sometimes I enjoy relaxing in the morning with a coffee if Iâ€™m not very hungry and then ordering food later, but unfortunately thatâ€™s not possible here.

This Korean fusion spot in the Theatre District is a great find. The happy hour is excellent, making it perfect for a pre-show meal without breaking the bank. Dishes are flavorful, creative, and arrive quicklyâ€”ideal when youâ€™re on a theatre schedule.

The space itself is spotless, and while the dÃ©cor is a little over the top (almost wired together in a quirky, mismatched way), it somehow works and adds to the fun atmosphere. Service is friendly and efficient, which makes the whole experience smooth and stress-free.

All in all, a lively place for tasty food, good drinks, and a playful vibe before heading to a Broadway show.
Great place for a nice breakfast/brunch

This place was delicious! We loved the atmosphere.  Plenty of seating and just a chill vibe. They offer table seating, you can sit at the bar as well as seating to look out the windows and you can open the windows if the weather is nice. The coffee and food was so yummy! I also asked to have a "meat" swapped and they were able to accommodate me.

We truly enjoyed eating here and would definitely go back! The location is a little bit of a walk from Time Square but close to the port.

This bar/restaurant is great! The food is excellent. The drinks are innovative. And most importantly the bartender provides professional service and knows his bar. Having tapas-sized portions makes it easy to try everything!
Good food, but poor service and unnecessarily overpriced. 2 entrees and 2 coffees will cost >$70.

Called September 6, 2025. Was told UT47 does not take reservations; first come, first served only.
Absolutely terrific vegan options!!

Wow!!! Had the absolute best time here! They were sooooooo nice and had the ultimate birthday celebration! Plus free popcorn! Will be back 10/10
Pro tip: tell the bartender what you like and heâ€™ll know exactly what you NEED
Great happy deals and friendly bar staff.

Had such a wonderful breakfast at UT47 Kitchen & Bar! I ordered the waffle with egg and avocado along with a dirty chai latteâ€”absolutely delicious. I asked for a couple of modifications (bacon on the side and lactose-free milk), and the staff did a fantastic job accommodating everything.

The presentation was perfectâ€”so much attention to detail! They even added a little chia coconut milk pudding on the side, which was such a thoughtful touch. The restaurant itself is beautifully designed and welcoming, making the whole experience even better.

Super friendly staff and great quality of Expresso.

It was my first time at UT 47 and Iâ€™m planning to bring all my friends next time! The menu has something for everyone, including vegan and gluten-free options. I tried the BLT, and the bacon was my new favorite! The bread was super flavorful and had a great texture, and it all went perfectly with the salad and the yummy vinaigrette dressing. To top it off, there was a delicious brownie that was bursting with flavor. The atmosphere is amazing, and itâ€™s a real treat for the eyes.

UT 47 was a DELICIOUS spot for brunch. The coffee was fantastic and the menu was even better. It felt New York but also with a fusion of Korean. Very great vibes and service was quick! We also enjoyed the vegan selection they had here for food and drinks!

As a tourist, I sat down and immediately loved the vibe of this place. Additionally, the staff was friendly and interacted with us just enough to not feel like they were hovering or overworking for a tip.

The food seemed overpriced at first glance at the menu but I will say I was pleasantly surprised when my ham and eggs Benedict on a croissant came out. Wow. Just wow. The flavor was incredible. My only complaint was that there wasn't more, but then again, I left full! So there's nothing to complain about! 10/10 go here for breakfast if you're in the area

I had a really enjoyable breakfast here. The owner was friendly and attentive, which made the experience feel personal and welcoming. The presentation was simple yet elegant, and the food was served with care. I also appreciated the thoughtful details. The overall atmosphere was calm and inviting.

I got a chance to try this restaurant for brunch. When I arrived I had trouble finding parking but did eventually. I walked in, and I was greeted and served by Jasmine. The place was small and cute. I ordered:

Vodka Martini
Vegan Salmon Egg's Benedict
Beef Bulgogi Korean Taco
Sweet Baked Bacon Egg's Benedict (Waffle) substitute chicken sausage

The drink was good, and my favorite was the waffle dish! It was so flavorful! I definitely enjoyed my meals!

I have eaten vegan food and/or breakfast many places in the world and alot in the USA but this spot is like no other.
So tasty and the combinations are so well thought out and then you have multiple options
As a business man, the fact they have regular options available as well for your love ones or others that you may be with is also a plus.
Give this place 10stars.
Must recommend!
Must share!
Must be back!
The food was perfect ( my daughter ordered sweet bacon and she doesn't like it ) but overall we enjoyed every single bite

Update (Augusy 2025)
I revisited this spot after my first visit in December, now that I've moved to NYC. Unfortunately, it's not the same anymore. The new location across the street lacks the charm the old one had. The food was still decent, but not nearly as good as my last visit. Not sure if the chef has changed. Last time, everything was exceptional. I still remember how perfectly crispy and flavorful the potatoes were amd that I had ordered an extra plate. This time, everything just tasted... average. It went from being my favorite brunch spot in the city to just another place. To top it off, the bathroom was dirty. Sad and disappointed ğŸ˜. Downgrading the review to 3 stars.

December 2024
Loved the eggs benedict. It's really cute restaurant decor, too.

Had this place on my list for a while. The entire menu is vegan. The food was delicious. We ordered tacos, which was delicious. The sandwich was ok, it was a bit dry. The service was good. The blueberry muffin was delicious. The sauce, which was served with a sandwich, was delicious.

Absolutely divine! My husband & I are locals & this is our absolute favorite brunch spot. I feel like the chef is so intentional with the combination of ingredients along with the presentation of every menu item. Overall portions are great, flavors are bursting, price point very fair. Fav items: bulgogi beef taco, beet salad, beef dumplings, any bfast Sammyâ€¦basically everything.

Highly recommend this spot if youâ€™re looking for a great place to enjoy a cocktail with a street view. Every cocktail Iâ€™ve tried here has been excellent, but the espresso martini is a standout-they make it with freshly pulled espresso, so itâ€™s extra rich and flavorful. Definitely a drink Iâ€™ll come back for!

Fantastic Korean comfort food in Hells Kitchen. As a fan of their other restaurant nearby, I was pleasantly impressed with their brunch Salmon Eggs Benedict. Fresh ingredients and good service. Could definitely use some fans in the summer time but theyre new and still figuring things out.

Culinary highlight of our trip to NYC!  Staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful, service was so speedy, GF options were plenty, and the food was AMAZING.  They made a waffle for my picky kid (which she said was the best waffle sheâ€™d ever eaten) and my dumplings were off the charts.

Gorgeous food. They were happy to adapt the menu for dairy and gluten free. Really fresh and delicioys: my favourite food this holiday. Also had the best mug of tea (with a side of milk) that I've had in NYC. Made an Englush woman very happy!

Absolutely love this restaurant, though I miss some of the more floral and natural decorations from their previous location. Friendly staff, cute decor and the best part is the delicious fusion food.

My favorite items here are the mermaid latte and the bulgogi beef tacos. I have been a regular that comes every other week and tried half of the menu, I have not had a bad dish here. Highly recommended.

Comfort Fusion Korean Food is an absolute must-try.

I finally made it there for dinnerâ€”though Iâ€™m usually a brunch person (they serve the best avocado toast Iâ€™ve ever had). But dinner did not disappoint. Every dish was fresh, flavorful, and thoughtfully prepared. Their happy hour menu is spot-on: a perfectly portioned meal and drink for just $23. I went for the tacos, while my husband enjoyed the bibimbapâ€”both were delicious.

Great options for vegan brunch. Although the vegan BLT was unexpectedly sweet, the quality of the food was excellent.i would return to try another vegan dish. Recommended for groups with various dietary needs (vegan, gluten free, nut free, etc). Service was great!
The vegan brunch was amazing.  The vegan eggs Benedict was delicious. Our server was awesome and helpful. The location is cozy and welcoming.

This new location on the corner is a HOT TIP for drinks and small bites! Love the super trendy vibe and flaming gorgeous drinks.
They also have a great happy hour menu with a mule that gives you huge portions of food at HH price.
The vegan tacos were to die for (even if you eat meat)!
The owner and service went above and beyond to give us some extras. Spread the word!
